channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Furloughs, closures and mass firings threats: What's next in the shutdown fight
item.description: On the first day of the government shutdown, Republicans and Democrats traded blame while a small bipartisan group of senators began to negotiate.

item.title: In Trump country, a Democrat critiques Trump — and talks of succeeding him
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear about his cross-party appeal in a state that has always overwhelmingly voted for Trump.

item.title: From Madagascar to Morocco: Gen Z protests shake Africa
item.description: Gen Z-led protests in two diverse African countries highlight frustration over years of poor governance. Fueled by social media, these youth movements...

item.title: Research, curriculum and grading: new data sheds light on how professors are using AI
item.description: It's not just students, more professors are using AI in the classroom. But they say more guidance is needed on how to use the technology.

item.title: Air traffic controllers helped end the last government shutdown, and may again
item.description: A shortage of air traffic controllers may have played a role in ending the last government shutdown in 2019. U.S airlines are once again bracing for p...

item.title: 8/28: CBS Morning News
item.description: Shooting at Minneapolis Catholic school leaves two children dead, 17 others injured; China trade tensions overshadow Nvidia earnings report.

item.title: 'Area of interest' found in search for girl who vanished 55 years ago
item.description: Police suspect three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer, originally from Bristol, was taken from a beach in Australia.

item.title: At least 4 wounded in attack outside synagogue in Manchester, England
item.description: Police in the English city of Manchester say a vehicle ramming and stabbing attack outside a synagogue left at least four members of the public wounde...

item.title: Trump uses government shutdown to dole out firings and political punishment
item.description: President Donald Trump has seized on the government shutdown as an opportunity to reshape the federal workforce and punish detractors.

item.title: Hamas military leader in Gaza objects to ceasefire plan, BBC understands
item.description: President Trump's proposal, accepted by Israel, stipulates that Hamas disarm and have no future role in governing Gaza.

item.title: More Americans are living paycheck to paycheck, foiling retirement plans
item.description: Roughly 42% of younger working adults — spanning Gen Z, millennials and Gen X — report having no money left over after covering their daily expenses.

item.title: White House says layoffs 'imminent' with no end to shutdown in sight
item.description: As a bitter standoff between Republicans and Democrats plays out, there is little sign that either side is willing to budge.

item.title: Head of Eisenhower library resigns after sword spat with Trump administration
item.description: A dispute over a gift given by President Trump to King Charles forced out the museum boss, sources say.

item.title: Israel intercepts Gaza flotilla and detains activists including Greta Thunberg
item.description: South Africa and Turkey have criticised the incident in international waters. Israel says those on board are safe.

item.title: Kenyan activists abducted in Uganda, opposition leader says
item.description: Bobi Wine says the two Kenyans were "picked up mafia-style" because they had joined his campaign.

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: National parks will remain ‘generally’ open during the shutdown, but Liberty Bell doors are closed
Bondi and Hegseth rally federal agents and troops in Memphis as part of crime task force
